name: Gentoo Linux (Rolling)
install_guide_markdown: Gentoo uses a source-based installation. Follow the official handbook for partitioning, stage3 installation, chroot, kernel build, and system configuration.

install_steps.title: Boot minimal ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Boot the minimal installation ISO and ensure networking is configured (use `iwctl` or `net-setup`).

install_steps.title: Partition disks
install_steps.detail_md: Create EFI and root partitions using `fdisk` or `parted`, then format filesystems.

install_steps.title: Download and extract stage3
install_steps.detail_md: Download the appropriate stage3 tarball, verify its signature, and extract to `/mnt/gentoo`.

install_steps.title: Chroot and configure
install_steps.detail_md: Mount filesystems, chroot into the new environment, configure Portage, timezone, locale, and build the kernel.

install_steps.title: Install bootloader
install_steps.detail_md: Install and configure GRUB or systemd-boot to boot into Gentoo.

privacy_notes: No telemetry by default; users control what is built and installed.
notes: Gentoo is highly customizable and best suited for experienced users who want full control over their system.
